snippet: The N.F.L.’s legal battles also involve how much money, if any, insurers are obligated to pay, and the dispute could hurt teams, leagues and schools at all levels in other contact sports.
abstract: NFL is engaged in a legal battle with 32 of its current and former insurers over how much they are obliged to pay as former players bring suits contending the league hid information about concussion; suits, regardless of outcome, could cause premiums to go up on a permanent basis.
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L.’s legal battles also involve how much money, if any, insurers are obligated to pay, and the dispute could hurt teams, leagues and schools at all levels in other contact sports.

headline.seo: Concussion Liability Issues Could Stretch Beyond N.F.L.
headline.main: Concussion Liability Costs May Rise, and Not Just for N.F.L.
headline.print_headline: Concussion Liability Issues Could Stretch Beyond N.F.L.
